feature.label: ElectroCodeoGram EclipseSensor with ECG Lab
feature.description: This feature provides a plugin that acts as a sensor inside Eclipse programming process events. It is part of the ElectroCodeoGram framework for "micro-process" recording and analysis. The "micro-process" is the sequence of very fine steps a programmer takes while working. Analysis of the "micor-process" is falling into the domain of empirical software engineering, with the goal to make software processes better and to minimize defect rates. The sensor plugin collects "micro-process" events like the opening of a file, the running or building of an application and even textual changes in active documents. The events are then sent to the ElectroCodeoGram's ECG Lab process, where they can be analysed and stored into file system files for instance. The ECG Lab comes along with this feature and the sensor plugin is configured to initiate the communication with the ECG Lab on its own.
